intro: Androsace olgae, commonly known as the Alpine mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its rosette of hairy, spoon-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Androsace olgae is often found in mountain meadows and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological significance in alpine ecosystems.
